Description: Painted limestone shabti of Nw-nb with a black and yellow striated lappet-wig, a brown carved face with black and white eyes, an incised red and yellow collar, brown crossed hands in relief holding the yellow incised hoes, the legs are inscribed with Chapter 6 of The Book of the Dead in eight rows of incised black Hieroglyphs extending around the sides, the backs of both arms are decorated with incised yellow representations of seed-baskets.
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Somerset Lowry-Corry, 2nd Earl of Belmore
